definition[0]: to pull a piece of clothing, bag etc so that the inside is facing out
example[0]: Turn the sweater inside out before you wash it.
definition[1]: to search everywhere for something, in a way that makes a place very untidy
example[1]: Thieves had turned the house upside down.
definition[2]: to completely change the way that something is done, organized, thought about etc
example[2]: New approaches to marketing turn old practices upside down.
example[3]: Her opinion of him had been turned on its head.
